DisableHealthChecks.description: Gets or sets a boolean value that indicates whether the Qdrant client health check is disabled or not.

Endpoint.description: The endpoint URI string of the Qdrant server to connect to.

HealthCheckTimeout.description: Gets or sets the timeout duration for the health check.

Key.description: The API Key of the Qdrant server to connect to.

Client.description: Provides the client configuration settings for connecting to a Qdrant server using QdrantClient.

AllowedHeaderNames.description: Gets or sets a list of header names that are not redacted during logging.

AllowedQueryParameters.description: Gets or sets a list of query parameter names that are not redacted during logging.

EnableLogging.description: Gets or sets value indicating if logging should be enabled in this client pipeline.

EnableMessageContentLogging.description: Gets or sets value indicating if request and response content should be logged.

EnableMessageLogging.description: Gets or sets value indicating if request and response uri and header information should be logged.

MessageContentSizeLimit.description: Gets or sets value indicating maximum size of content to log in bytes.

ClientLoggingOptions.description: The options to be used to configure logging within the 'System.ClientModel.Primitives.ClientPipeline'.

EnableDistributedTracing.description: Gets or sets whether distributed tracing should be enabled. If null, this value will be treated as true. The default is null.

Endpoint.description: The service endpoint that the client will send requests to. If not set, the default endpoint will be used.

NetworkTimeout.description: The timeout applied to an individual network operation.

OrganizationId.description: The value to use for the OpenAI-Organization request header. Users who belong to multiple organizations can set this value to specify which organization is used for an API request. Usage from these API requests will count against the specified organization's quota. If not set, the header will be omitted, and the default organization will be billed. You can change your default organization in your user settings. Learn more.

ProjectId.description: The value to use for the OpenAI-Project request header. Users who are accessing their projects through their legacy user API key can set this value to specify which project is used for an API request. Usage from these API requests will count as usage for the specified project. If not set, the header will be omitted, and the default project will be accessed.

UserAgentApplicationId.description: An optional application ID to use as part of the request User-Agent header.

ClientOptions.description: The options to configure the client.

DisableMetrics.description: Gets or sets a boolean value that indicates whether the OpenTelemetry metrics are enabled or not.

DisableTracing.description: Gets or sets a boolean value that indicates whether the OpenTelemetry tracing is disabled or not.

Endpoint.description: Gets or sets a 'System.Uri' referencing the OpenAI REST API endpoint. Leave empty to connect to OpenAI, or set it to use a service using an API compatible with OpenAI.

Key.description: Gets or sets a the API key to used to authenticate with the service.

OpenAI.description: The settings relevant to accessing OpenAI.

AllowedHeaderNames.description: Gets or sets a list of header names that are not redacted during logging.

AllowedQueryParameters.description: Gets or sets a list of query parameter names that are not redacted during logging.

EnableLogging.description: Gets or sets value indicating if logging should be enabled in this client pipeline.

EnableMessageContentLogging.description: Gets or sets value indicating if request and response content should be logged.

EnableMessageLogging.description: Gets or sets value indicating if request and response uri and header information should be logged.

MessageContentSizeLimit.description: Gets or sets value indicating maximum size of content to log in bytes.

ClientLoggingOptions.description: The options to be used to configure logging within the 'System.ClientModel.Primitives.ClientPipeline'.

EnableDistributedTracing.description: Gets or sets whether distributed tracing should be enabled. If null, this value will be treated as true. The default is null.

NetworkTimeout.description: The timeout applied to an individual network operation.

UserAgentApplicationId.description: An optional application ID to use as part of the request User-Agent header.

ClientOptions.description: Defines the scenario-independent, client-level options for the Azure-specific OpenAI client.

DisableMetrics.description: Gets or sets a boolean value that indicates whether the OpenTelemetry metrics are enabled or not.

DisableTracing.description: Gets or sets a boolean value that indicates whether the OpenTelemetry tracing is disabled or not.

Endpoint.description: Gets or sets a 'System.Uri' referencing the Azure OpenAI endpoint. This is likely to be similar to "https://{account_name}.openai.azure.com".

Key.description: Gets or sets the key to use to authenticate to the Azure OpenAI endpoint.

OpenAI.description: The settings relevant to accessing Azure OpenAI or OpenAI.
